description: The SURGICAL_HX table contains data from medical history contacts entered in clinical system patient encounters. Since one patient encounter may contain multiple medical history contacts, each contact is uniquely identified by a combination of the patient encounter serial number and a line number.

columns.name: PAT_ENC_DATE_REAL
columns.description: This is a numeric representation of the date of this encounter in your system. The integer portion of the number specifies the date of the encounter. The digits after the decimal point indicate multiple visits on one day.

columns.name: LINE
columns.description: The line number of the surgical history contact within the encounter.

columns.name: PROC_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the procedure record associated with the surgical history contact. Note: This is NOT the CPT(R) code. It is an internal identifier that is typically not visible to a user.

columns.name: SURGICAL_HX_DATE
columns.description: The free-text date entered in a patient's Surgical History for the procedure.

columns.name: COMMENTS
columns.description: Free-text comments entered for the procedure in the surgical history contact.

columns.name: PROC_COMMENTS
columns.description: Free-text comments entered for the "other" procedure in the patient's surgical history.

columns.name: CONTACT_DATE
columns.description: The contact date of the encounter associated with this surgical history contact. Note: There may be multiple encounters on the same calendar date.

columns.name: CM_CT_OWNER_ID
columns.description: ID of the deployment owner for this contact.

columns.name: PAT_ENC_CSN_ID
columns.description: A unique serial number for this encounter. This number is unique across all patients and encounters in the system.

columns.name: SURGICAL_HX_SRC_C_NAME
columns.description:
This category number represents the source of entry, the person providing the information, for the surgical history data.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Provider


Patient


Parent


Legal Guardian


Proxy User

columns.name: HX_LNK_ENC_CSN
columns.description: The Contact Serial Number of the encounter in which the history was created/edited. If the history was created/edited outside of the context of an encounter, then this column will be blank.

columns.name: SURGICAL_HX_SRG_CSN
columns.description: Stores the contact serial number of the surgery contact related to the current procedure.

columns.name: SURG_LATERALITY_C_NAME
columns.description:
This category is used to store the laterality for each past surgical record in surgical history. 


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Left


Right


Bilateral


N/A


Default

columns.name: SURG_HX_START_DT
columns.description: The starting date for the range of possible dates extracted from the free text date entered in column SURGICAL_HX_DATE. It is filled in automatically when the patient's history is saved. The ending date is in column SURG_HX_END_DT.

columns.name: SURG_HX_END_DT
columns.description: The ending date for the range of possible dates extracted from the free text date entered in column SURGICAL_HX_DATE. It is filled in automatically when the patient's history is saved. The starting date is in SURG_HX_END_DT.

columns.name: SURG_HX_ORDER_ID
columns.description: The unique ID of the order related to the current surgical history procedure
